content: Move our custom element definitions inside of a function called defineCustomElements(), and call this from <room onload="defineCustomElements()">

The createObject() function's first argument should be the class of object to create - built-in classes are object, image, particle, link, text, sound, video, light, and paragraph.

For the object class, the "id" parameter refers to one of the following primitive types: plane, cube, sphere, cylinder, torus, pipe, pyramid, cone, capsule

The first argument to createObject() can also refer to any of our custom element types. As such, in our airhockey-table class, instead of creating primitives for our goal, puck, and paddles, we should create airhockey-goal, airhockey-pick, and airhockey-paddle objects, respectively.
